div.p: No.6391, pp. 292-3, unit 77, VPRS 1187/P, outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Document is a circular (p. 392) sent to the heads of twelve ministries (listed p. 393). In the Chief Secretary's Office, the Under Secretary, T. Wilson, then forwarded it to departmental heads, including M. Melbourne, 25th October 1886.

I am directed by the Honorable the Treasurer to bring under your notice that delay frequently occurs in rendering the security required from officers in the Public Service, delay resulting sometimes in loss, and always in unnecessary trouble and correspondence.

I am to add that excuses for the non rendering of security of
or? for not renewing it periodically are not to be accepted unless deemed by the Treasurer to be satisfactory.
See M to A Deakin, November 1886 (in this edition as 86-11-00).
